{{{
#!graphviz/svg 

digraph Harmonie {
	graph [fontsize=30,
		label="Data Assimilation in Harmonie-Arome",
		labelloc=t,
		rank=min
	];
	node [target=_blank,
		type=CONSTfile
	];
	edge [type=staticinput];
	subgraph cluster_legend {
		graph [fontsize=20,
			label=Directories
		];
		WRKfile		 [fillcolor=powderblue,
			label="$WRK",
			shape=ellipse,
			style=filled,
			tooltip="$HM_DATA/$YYYY$MM$DD_$HH",
			type=WRKfile];
		ARCHIVEfile		 [fillcolor=coral,
			label="$ARCHIVE",
			shape=ellipse,
			style=filled,
			tooltip="$HM_DATA/archive/$YYYY/$MM/$DD/$HH",
			type=ARCHIVEfile];
	}
	Prepare_pgd	 [SCRDIR="./scr/",
		fid=3,
		label=<<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLBORDER="1" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="4">
         <TR> <TD COLSPAN="2" BGCOLOR="gold"> Prepare_pgd </TD> </TR> 
         <TR> <TD BGCOLOR="orangered" HREF="">wiki</TD>
         <TD BGCOLOR="gold" HREF="https://github.com/roelstappers/Harmonie/tree/master/scr/Prepare_pgd"> git </TD>  
          </TR> </TABLE>>,
		script=Prepare_pgd,
		shape=plaintext,
		tooltip=" Building of the surfex climate file for &#13;&#10; the requested domain&#13;&#10;",
		type=ecflowtask,
		wikicolor=orangered];
	Prepare_ob	 [SCRDIR="./scr/",
                fid=3,
		href="https://hirlam.org/trac/wiki/HarmonieSystemDocumentation/ObservationPreprocessing/ObservationData",
		label=<<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLBORDER="1" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="4">
         <TR> <TD COLSPAN="2" BGCOLOR="gold"> Prepare_ob </TD> </TR> 
         <TR> <TD BGCOLOR="gold" HREF="https://hirlam.org/trac/wiki/HarmonieSystemDocumentation/ObservationPreprocessing/ObservationData">wiki</TD>
         <TD BGCOLOR="gold" HREF="https://github.com/roelstappers/Harmonie/tree/master/scr/Prepare_ob"> git </TD>  
          </TR> </TABLE>>,
		script=Prepare_ob,
		shape=plaintext,
		tooltip="Prepare_ob: Copy/prepare BUFR observation file&#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;Arguments: none&#13;&#10;- Extract BUFR data from MARS if obYYYYMMDDHH \
file is not found&#13;&#10;- Split the bufr file per observation type ( ShuffleBufr )&#13;&#10;",
		type=ecflowtask,
		wikicolor=gold];
	obYYYYMMDD	 [fillcolor=powderblue,
		label="observations/ob$YYYYMMDD",
		shape=ellipse,
		style=filled,
		type=WRKfile];
	Prepare_ob -> obYYYYMMDD	 [type=""];
	Bator	 [SCRDIR="./scr/",
		fid=3,
		href="https://hirlam.org/trac/wiki/HarmonieSystemDocumentation/ObservationPreprocessing/Bator",
		label=<<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLBORDER="1" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="4">
         <TR> <TD COLSPAN="2" BGCOLOR="gold"> Bator </TD> </TR> 
         <TR> <TD BGCOLOR="gold" HREF="https://hirlam.org/trac/wiki/HarmonieSystemDocumentation/ObservationPreprocessing/Bator">wiki</TD>
         <TD BGCOLOR="gold" HREF="https://github.com/roelstappers/Harmonie/tree/master/scr/Bator"> git </TD>  
          </TR> </TABLE>>,
		script=Bator,
		shape=plaintext,
		tooltip="-----------------------------------------------------------------&#13;&#10;This function calls BATODB in a cycle to convert ascii \
OBSOUL&#13;&#10;files into ECMA ODB sub-bases. When all the sub-bases are &#13;&#10;created SHUFFLE-MERGE is called to create the \
virtual basis for&#13;&#10;the sub-bases, i.e. to create a complete ECMA ODB database.&#13;&#10;-----------------------------------------------------------------&#\
13;&#10;BATODB requires several input files:&#13;&#10;    -OBSOUL: ascii observation file &#13;&#10;    -LISTE_NOIRE_DIAP:             &#\
13;&#10;    -LISTE_LOC:&#13;&#10;The input directory structure (after the merge): &#13;&#10;    ${d_DB}/ECMA/...&#13;&#10;           /\
ECMA.${base1}/....&#13;&#10;           /ECMA.${base2}/....&#13;&#10;            ...&#13;&#10;  where the stucture of the virtual \
basis: &#13;&#10;       ECMA->|->ECMA.dd&#13;&#10;             |->ECMA.sch&#13;&#10;             |->ECMA.poolmask&#13;&#10;             |\
->IOASSIGN&#13;&#10;  and the structure of the sub-bases:&#13;&#10;       ECMA.${base}->|->ECMA.dd&#13;&#10;                     |\
->ECMA.sch&#13;&#10;                     |->ECMA.flags&#13;&#10;                     |->1&#13;&#10;------------------------------------------------------                 &#\
13;&#10;  Globals: YMD, HH, d_ASSIM, types_BASE, NBPROC&#13;&#10;------------------------------------------------------           &#\
13;&#10;",
		type=ecflowtask,
		wikicolor=gold];
	obYYYYMMDD -> Bator	 [type=""];
	Oulan	 [SCRDIR="./scr/",
		fid=3,
		href="https://hirlam.org/trac/wiki/HarmonieSystemDocumentation/ObservationPreprocessing/Oulan",
		label=<<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLBORDER="1" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="4">
         <TR> <TD COLSPAN="2" BGCOLOR="gold"> Oulan </TD> </TR> 
         <TR> <TD BGCOLOR="gold" HREF="https://hirlam.org/trac/wiki/HarmonieSystemDocumentation/ObservationPreprocessing/Oulan">wiki</TD>
         <TD BGCOLOR="gold" HREF="https://github.com/roelstappers/Harmonie/tree/master/scr/Oulan"> git </TD>  
          </TR> </TABLE>>,
		script=Oulan,
		shape=plaintext,
		tooltip="Oulan: observation preprocessing&#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;Arguments: none&#13;&#10;- Create the OBSOUL file to be used by BATOR ( Oulan )&#\
13;&#10;",
		type=ecflowtask,
		wikicolor=gold];
	obYYYYMMDD -> Oulan	 [type=""];
	odb	 [fillcolor=powderblue,
		shape=ellipse,
		style=filled,
		type=WRKfile];
	Bator -> odb	 [type=""];
	odb_can_ori	 [fillcolor=powderblue,
		shape=ellipse,
		style=filled,
		type=WRKfile];
	Bator -> odb_can_ori	 [type=""];
	OBSOUL	 [fillcolor=powderblue,
		label="oulan/OBSOUL",
		shape=ellipse,
		style=filled,
		type=WRKfile];
	Oulan -> OBSOUL	 [type=""];
	Boundary_strategy	 [SCRDIR="./scr/",
		fid=3,
		href="https://hirlam.org/trac/wiki/HarmonieSystemDocumentation/40h1.1/BoundaryFilePreparation",
		label=<<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLBORDER="1" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="4">
         <TR> <TD COLSPAN="2" BGCOLOR="gold"> Boundary_strategy </TD> </TR> 
         <TR> <TD BGCOLOR="gold" HREF="https://hirlam.org/trac/wiki/HarmonieSystemDocumentation/40h1.1/BoundaryFilePreparation">wiki</TD>
         <TD BGCOLOR="gold" HREF="https://github.com/roelstappers/Harmonie/tree/master/scr/Boundary_strategy.pl"> git </TD>  
          </TR> </TABLE>>,
		script="Boundary_strategy.pl",
		shape=plaintext,
		tooltip="Find best fitted boundaries in BDPATH&#13;&#10;Ulf Andrae, SMHI 2008&#13;&#10;Strategies defined are:&#13;&#10;available    : Search \
for available files in BDDIR, try to keep forecast consistency&#13;&#10;               This is meant to be used operationally&#13;&#\
10;same_forecast: Use all boundaries from the same forecast, start from analysis&#13;&#10;enda         : Same as same_forecast but \
for ECMWF ENDA data &#13;&#10;               06 and 18 UTC: same cycle&#13;&#10;               00 and 12 UTC: 6h earlier ENDA data &#\
13;&#10;eps_ec       : Like enda but from the GLAMEPS archive of ECMWF ENS data&#13;&#10;eps_ec_oper  : Like enda but from ECMWF \
operational ENS runs&#13;&#10;analysis_only: Use only analysises as boundaries&#13;&#10;latest       : Use the latest possible boundary \
with the shortest forecast length&#13;&#10;RCR_operational : Mimic the behaviour of the RCR runs, ie&#13;&#10;                  \
12h old boundaries at 00 and 12 and&#13;&#10;                  06h old boundaries at 06 and 18&#13;&#10;simulate_operational :  \
Mimic the behaviour of the operational runs using ECMWF LBC, ie, 6 hour old boundary.&#13;&#10;The output bdstrategy file has the \
format of &#13;&#10;NNN|YYYYMMDDHH INT_BDFILE BDFILE BDFILE_REQUEST_METHOD&#13;&#10;Where &#13;&#10;NNN        is the input hour&#\
13;&#10;YYYYMMDDHH is the valid hour for this boundary&#13;&#10;INT_BDFILE is the final boundary file&#13;&#10;BDFILE     is the \
input boundary file&#13;&#10;BDFILE_REQUEST_METHOD is the method to the request BDFILE from e.g. MARS, ECFS or via scp&#13;&#10;\
Extended usage&#13;&#10;EXT_BDDIR and EXT_ACCESS can be defined by user&#13;&#10;If we in sms/config_exp.h define and export e.g.&#\
13;&#10;EXT_BDDIR=smhi:/data/ariv/E11/@YYYY@/@MM@/@DD@/@HH@/E11_@YYYY@@MM@@DD@@HH@00+0@LLL@H00M&#13;&#10;with optional EXT_BDFILE=\
SOME_FILENAME&#13;&#10;EXT_ACCESS=scp&#13;&#10;We would expect to make an scp of EXT_BDDIR/EXT_BDFILE to BDDIR&#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;\
Rules for name convention and access is defined in %rules below.&#13;&#10;Alternatively nameing can be given in sms/config_exp.h \
via BDDIR&#13;&#10;(\"+\" must be included) e.g.&#13;&#10;BDDIR=/hirlam/RCRa/@YYYY@/@MM@/@DD@/@HH@/fc@YYYY@@MM@@DD@@HH@00+@LLL@md&#\
13;&#10;With filenames without the \"+\" you must define and export BDFILE in sms/config_exp.h&#13;&#10;Defined rules depending on \
HOST_MODEL&#13;&#10;",
		type=ecflowtask,
		wikicolor=gold];
	bdstrategy_archive	 [fillcolor=coral,
		label=bdstrategy,
		shape=ellipse,
		style=filled,
		type=ARCHIVEfile];
	Boundary_strategy -> bdstrategy_archive	 [type=""];
	bdstrategy	 [fillcolor=powderblue,
		shape=ellipse,
		style=filled,
		type=WRKfile];
	bdstrategy_archive -> bdstrategy	 [label=Boundary_strategy,
		style=dashed];

blending)&#13;&#10;ANASURF (none)&#13;&#10;DTG relative DTGBEG&#13;&#10;FG  : FA     first guess&#13;&#10;FGS : SURFEX first guess&#\
13;&#10;The very first guess can be defined by the user through FIRST_FG/FIRST_FGS&#13;&#10;",
		type=ecflowtask,
		wikicolor=orangered];
	bdstrategy -> FirstGuess	 [type=""];

		script=Interpol_ec_sst,

		href="https://hirlam.org/trac/wiki/HarmonieSystemDocumentation/Screening",
		label=<<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLBORDER="1" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="4">
         <TR> <TD COLSPAN="2" BGCOLOR="gold"> Screening </TD> </TR> 
         <TR> <TD BGCOLOR="gold" HREF="https://hirlam.org/trac/wiki/HarmonieSystemDocumentation/Screening">wiki</TD>
         <TD BGCOLOR="gold" HREF="https://github.com/roelstappers/Harmonie/tree/master/scr/Screening"> git </TD>  
          </TR> </TABLE>>,
		script=Screening,
		shape=plaintext,
		tooltip="----------------------------------------------------------------------&#13;&#10;Run screening (configuration 002 of ARPEGE/IFS model):&#\
13;&#10;quality control of observation.&#13;&#10;--------------------------------------------------------------------&#13;&#10;Inputs:&#\
13;&#10;  #--first guess (the same file with 5  different names):&#13;&#10;    ICMSHMIN1INIT  ICMSHMIN1IMIN  ICMRFMIN10000&#13;&#\
10;    ELSCFMIN1ALBC000 ELSCFMIN1ALBC&#13;&#10;  #--Input/output ODB directory structure&#13;&#10;    ${d_DB}/ECMA&#13;&#10;           /\
ECMA.${base1}&#13;&#10;           ....&#13;&#10;  #--Constants and statistics&#13;&#10;    (1)correl.dat (2)sigmab.dat (3)rszcoef_\
fmt (4)errgrib&#13;&#10;    (5)rt_coef_atovs_newpred_ieee.dat&#13;&#10;    (6)bcor_noaa.dat (7)chanspec_noaa.dat&#13;&#10;    (8)\
rmtberr_noaa.dat (9)cstlim_noaa.dat&#13;&#10;Output:&#13;&#10;   The quality control information will be put into the&#13;&#10;   \
input ODB.&#13;&#10;----------------------------------------------------------&#13;&#10;",
		type=ecflowtask,
		wikicolor=gold];
	odb -> Screening	 [type=""];
	Canari	 [SCRDIR="./scr/",
		fid=3,
		href="https://hirlam.org/trac/wiki/HarmonieSystemDocumentation/Analysis/CANARI",
		label=<<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLBORDER="1" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="4">

model)&#13;&#10;----------------------------------------------------------------------&#13;&#10;Inputs:&#13;&#10;  #--first guess (\
the same file with 2  different names):  &#13;&#10;    ICMSHMIN1INIT&#13;&#10;    ELSCFMIN1ALBC000&#13;&#10;  #--Input/output (CCMA) \
ODB directory structure, containing only &#13;&#10;     the active observations:&#13;&#10;    ${d_DBCAN}/CCMA&#13;&#10;              /\
CCMA.${base1}&#13;&#10;              ....&#13;&#10;  #--Constants and statistics   &#13;&#10;    (1)rszcoef_fmt,  etc.&#13;&#10;\
Outputs:&#13;&#10;  #--Surface analysis&#13;&#10;  #--The oi (update) information will be put into the &#13;&#10;     input (CCMA) \
ODB.&#13;&#10;----------------------------------------------------------&#13;&#10;  Globals: ...&#13;&#10;----------------------------------------------------------&#\
13;&#10;",
		type=ecflowtask,
		wikicolor=gold];

guess (the same file with 5  different names):  &#13;&#10;    ICMSHMIN1INIT  ICMSHMIN1IMIN  ICMRFMIN10000   &#13;&#10;    ELSCFMIN1ALBC000 \
ELSCFMIN1ALBC     &#13;&#10;  #--Input/output (CCMA) ODB directory structure, containing only &#13;&#10;     the active observations:&#\

13;&#10;    (1)rszcoef_fmt (2)rt_coef_atovs_newpred_ieee.dat , etc.&#13;&#10;    (3)stabal96.cv (4)stabal96.bal&#13;&#10;Outputs:&#\
13;&#10;  #--Upper air analysis (MXMIN1999+0000) under the name of POS2&#13;&#10;  #--The minimization (update) information will \
be put into the &#13;&#10;     input (CCMA) ODB.&#13;&#10;----------------------------------------------------------&#13;&#10;  \
Globals: d_STATFILES,d_CST,d_ASSIM,NBPROC,d_CCMA&#13;&#10;----------------------------------------------------------&#13;&#10;",
